item.title: 香港财务总监预计第二季度零售销售将反弹
item.description: 香港财政司司长陈茂波表示，他预计第二季度私人消费将在连续 12 个多月下降后出现反弹。【原文：Hong Kong Financial Secretary Paul Chan said he expects a bounce-back in second-quarter private consumption, following more than 12 months of decline.】

item.title: 中国工业利润在价格战中连续第二个月下降
item.description: 中国工业收益连续第二个月下降，政府将加大力度抑制过度竞争，因为过度竞争拖累了价格，加剧了美国关税带来的痛苦。【原文：China’s industrial earnings fell for a second straight month, with authorities set to intensify their drive to rein in excessive competition that’s dragging down prices and compounding the pain from US tariffs.】

item.title: 全球资金追逐全球最炙手可热的韩国主要股市
item.description: 韩国股票已经成为今年全球主要市场中表现最好的股票，随着旨在提高估值和赋予小股东权力的大胆监管改革取得成效，韩国股票正成为吸引外国投资者的磁石。【原文：South Korean stocks, already this year’s best performers among the world’s major markets, are becoming a magnet for foreign investors as bold regulatory reforms to lift valuations and empower minority shareholders gain traction.】

item.title: 在特朗普推动的反弹之后，日本投资者为日本央行和财报做好准备
item.description: 日本出人意料地与美国达成贸易协议，令其市场狂飙突进，推动股市创下历史新高，并加剧了政府债券的抛售。【原文：Japan’s surprise trade deal with the US sent its markets on a wild ride, pushing stocks to all-time highs and fueling a selloff in government bonds.】

item.title: 美联储主席鲍威尔在 GDP 和就业数据公布前压力倍增
item.description: 美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔（Jerome Powell）和他的同事们将于周二步入央行会议室，在巨大的政治压力、不断变化的贸易政策和经济交叉潮流中商讨利率问题。【原文：Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell and his colleagues will step into the central bank’s board room on Tuesday to deliberate on interest rates at a time of immense political pressure, evolving trade policy, and economic cross-currents.】

item.title: 不断增加的财政赤字导致数十亿美元的信贷投入
item.description: 有迹象表明，投资者正在将资金从政府债券中撤出，转而投向美国和欧洲的公司债券。【原文：Investors are showing signs of pulling money out of government bonds and plowing it into US and European company debt.】

item.title: 联合太平洋公司据说接近达成收购诺福克南方公司的交易
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，联合太平洋公司（Union Pacific Corp）最快将于下周初就收购诺福克南方公司（Norfolk Southern Corp.【原文：Union Pacific Corp. could reach an agreement to acquire Norfolk Southern Corp. and create a transcontinental rail behemoth as soon as early next week, people familiar with the matter said.】

item.title: 安联人寿称大部分客户数据在漏洞中被盗
item.description: 北美安联人寿保险公司称，7 月 16 日该公司遭遇系统漏洞，140 万客户中的大部分受到影响。【原文：Allianz Life Insurance Company of North America said it suffered a system breach on July 16 that affected a majority of its 1.4 million customers.】

item.title: 特朗普对巴西征收 50%关税可能使圣保罗州国内生产总值下降 2.7
item.description: 巴西圣保罗州州长塔尔西西奥-德弗雷塔斯（Tarcisio de Freitas）周六表示，巴西圣保罗州正在制定措施，以减轻将于8月1日生效的50%对美出口关税可能带来的影响。【原文：The Brazilian state of Sao Paulo is working on measures to mitigate the impact of potential 50% tariffs on exports to the US set to take effect on Aug. 1, Governor Tarcisio de Freitas said on Saturday.】

item.title: 据说 KKR 正在洽谈收购 STT GDC，交易价值 50 亿美元
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，KKR & Co.公司正在洽谈收购 ST Telemedia Global Data Centres 公司，这笔交易对这家亚洲数字基础设施提供商的估值可能超过 50 亿美元。【原文：KKR & Co. is in talks to buy ST Telemedia Global Data Centres in a deal that could value the Asian digital infrastructure provider at more than $5 billion, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 美国卫生官员和科技高管将启动数据共享计划
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，特朗普政府的高级卫生官员预计将于本周把科技公司请到白宫，推出一项鼓励更无缝地共享医疗数据的计划。【原文：Top Trump administration health officials are expected to bring tech companies to the White House this week to roll out a plan to encourage more seamless sharing of health-care data, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 波兰图斯克警告高额债务和赤字的后果
item.description: 波兰总理唐纳德-图斯克（Donald Tusk）对波兰公共债务和赤字增加的后果发出警告，因为国防仍是波兰的首要支出。【原文：Poland’s Prime Minister Donald Tusk warned against the consequences of the country’s increased public debt and deficit as defense remains the country’s top spending priority.】

item.title: 市场能否降低房价并照顾好我们的孩子？
item.description:
特朗普总统上任之初曾承诺要进行全面的经济变革。【原文：

President Trump came to office promising sweeping economic changes.

】

item.title: 俄罗斯一度火热的战争经济出现更多裂痕
item.description: 三年多前，俄罗斯总统弗拉基米尔-普京全面入侵乌克兰，面对国际制裁，俄罗斯经济依然保持着顽强的生命力，令许多人感到惊讶。俄罗斯经济甚至一度面临过热的风险。【原文：Russia’s economy surprised many by remaining resilient in the face of international sanctions following President Vladimir Putin’s full-scale invasion of Ukraine more than three years ago. At one point it even appeared to be running the risk of overheating.】

item.title: 全球经济图表：欧洲央行一年来首次按兵不动
item.description: 欧洲中央银行一年多来首次维持利率不变，因为它在寻求欧盟与美国贸易关系的明朗化。【原文：The European Central Bank kept interest rates unchanged for the first time in more than a year as it looks for clarity on the European Union’s trade ties with the US.】

item.title: 马来西亚数千人集会要求总理安瓦尔辞职
item.description: 数以千计的马来西亚人在首都集会，要求总理安瓦尔-易卜拉欣辞职，因为他被指未履行承诺，而且他的政府最近饱受争议。【原文：Thousands of Malaysians rallied in the nation’s capital demanding the resignation of Prime Minister Anwar Ibrahim over alleged unfulfilled promises and recent controversies surrounding his administration.】

item.title: 伊朗东南部司法大楼遭袭，五人死亡：米赞
item.description: 据司法部门的米赞通讯社报道，伊朗东南部锡斯坦和俾路支斯坦省扎黑丹的司法部门总部周六遭到袭击，造成 5 人死亡，13 人受伤。【原文：Five people were killed and 13 injured in an attack on Iran’s judiciary headquarters in Zahedan in the southeastern Sistan and Baluchestan Province on Saturday, the judiciary’s Mizan news agency reported.】

item.title: 美国与中国的贸易战如何演变成一场热战
item.description:

item.title: 奇货可居：中国贸易战如何演变为热战（播客）
item.description: 一段时间以来，中美之间的紧张关系一直在加剧。但迄今为止，这仅限于贸易问题。美国对中国征收关税。它对技术出口施加了限制。反过来，中国也征收了一些关税，并限制稀土金属等产品的出口。但从历史上看，许多热战都源于国家间某种与贸易有关的紧张关系。因此，贸易战有朝一日演变成热战的风险是存在的。因此【原文：Tension between the US and China has been building for some time. But so far this has been limited to issues of trade. The US has imposed tariffs on China. It’s imposed restrictions on technology exports. In turn, China has imposed some of its own tariffs, and also limited the export of things like rare earth metals. But historically speaking, many hot wars have their roots in some kind of trade-related tensions between nations. So the risk exists that a trade war one day becomes a hot war. So h】

item.title: 惠誉下调芬兰信用评级，原因是债务不断增加
item.description: 惠誉国际评级公司（Fitch Ratings）因芬兰未能控制不断膨胀的债务而下调了这个北欧国家的信用评级，这是芬兰近十年来首次被下调信用评级。【原文：Finland suffered its first downgrade in almost a decade after Fitch Ratings cut the Nordic country’s credit rating over its failure to rein in ballooning debt.】

item.title: 国际货币基金组织支持支持乍得经济的 6.25 亿美元贷款协议
item.description: 国际货币基金组织周五批准了一项总额为 6.25 亿美元的乍得计划，其中包括立即支付 3850 万美元。【原文：The International Monetary Fund approved a $625-million program for Chad on Friday, including an immediate disbursement of $38.5 million.】

item.title: 特朗普关税让代价高昂的中国供应问题悬而未决
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普总统最近达成的一系列贸易协议让亚洲出口商在关税问题上有了一些明确的认识，但在如何避免针对中国供应链的惩罚性关税方面还缺少一些关键细节。【原文：President Donald Trump’s recent flurry of trade deals have given Asian exporters some clarity on tariffs, but missing are key details on how to avoid punitive rates that target China’s supply chains.】

item.title: 欧洲央行行长西波罗内看到经济中的 "矛盾信号
item.description: 欧洲中央银行执行董事会成员皮埃罗-西波隆（Piero Cipollone）表示，经济正在发出 "相互矛盾的信号"，官员们正在等待更多的明确信息，然后再重新考虑是否需要进一步降低利率。【原文：European Central Bank Executive Board member Piero Cipollone said the economy is sending “conflicting signals” as officials wait for more clarity before taking a fresh view on whether interest rates need to be lowered any further.】

item.title: 中国总理瞄准人工智能 "垄断"，美国正加紧努力
item.description:
中国总理周六在上海举行的世界人工智能大会上表示，中国将牵头成立一个国际组织，共同发展人工智能。【原文：

China will spearhead the creation of an international organization to jointly develop AI, the country’s premier told the World Artificial Intelligence Conference in Shanghai on Saturday.

】

item.title: 美国国家航空航天局称数千名员工将从航天局辞职
item.description: 美国国家航空航天局（NASA）将通过自愿辞职计划失去大约 3870 名员工，这是唐纳德-特朗普总统的政府广泛推动削减联邦员工队伍的一部分。【原文：NASA will lose roughly 3,870 employees through a voluntary resignation program, part of a broad push from President Donald Trump’s administration to reduce the federal workforce.】

item.title: 巴西投资者警告大选中关税的政治影响
item.description: 在圣保罗举行的一次大型金融市场会议上，唐纳德-特朗普威胁对巴西征收 50%的关税几乎没有成为主要的经济问题。真正令资金经理们感到不安的是政治后果，即这位美国总统在明年大选前掀起的更大风暴。【原文：At a large financial market gathering in Sao Paulo, Donald Trump’s threat to impose 50% tariffs on Brazil barely registers as a primary economic concern. What’s truly unsettling money managers is the political fallout — the broader storm unleashed by the US president ahead of next year’s elections.】

item.title: 美国牛群统计显示牛肉价格飙升仍未结束
item.description: 尽管牛群清算周期似乎即将结束，但美国最新的牛群统计数字并没有让支付创纪录牛肉价格的消费者感到宽慰。【原文：The latest US cattle tally offered little relief for consumers paying record beef prices, even as the cycle of herd liquidation seems to be coming to an end.】

item.title: 赞比亚承诺加快改革步伐后从国际货币基金组织获得 1.84 亿美元资金
item.description: 在赞比亚同意加快改革以促进经济增长并征收更多税收之后，国际货币基金组织同意立即向该国支付 1.84 亿美元。【原文：The International Monetary Fund agreed to immediately disburse $184 million to Zambia, after the country agreed to expedite reforms to boost economic growth and collect more taxes.】

item.title: 穆迪将土耳其评级上调至 Ba3，原因是政策制定得到改善
item.description: 穆迪（Moody's）上调了土耳其的信用评级，这对政策制定者是一个鼓舞。周五，穆迪将土耳其的评级从B1上调至Ba3，仍比投资级低三个等级，评级展望为稳定。【原文：Turkey got a credit-rating upgrade from Moody’s in a boost to policymakers. The nation’s rating was raised Friday to Ba3 from B1, still three notches below investment grade, with a stable outlook.】

item.title: 华尔街 "备忘录 "股 "怒吼 "消退，零售业找到新乐趣
item.description: 它曾是反抗华尔街富裕阶层的象征。如今，它只是市场的又一天。【原文：It was once a symbol of rebellion against the well-heeled Wall Street establishment. Today, it’s just another day in markets.】
